alert.note: Alert for Clayton (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LaCrosse (Southwestern Wisconsin, Southeastern Minnesota, and Northeast Iowa)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 27 at 7:17PM CST until March 01 at 9:45AM CST by NWS LaCrosse
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Iowa... Turkey River at Garber affecting Clayton County. Turkey River at Elkader affecting Clayton County. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE WEDNESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Turkey River at Garber. * WHEN...Until late Wednesday morning. * IMPACTS...At 19.0 feet, County Road X3C at the south end of Garber becomes inundated. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:15 PM CST Monday the stage was 17.9 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 6:15 PM CST Monday was 17.9 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 19.7 feet tomorrow morning. It will then fall below flood stage late tomorrow evening. - Flood stage is 17.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 19.6 feet on 06/04/2002. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional river and weather information is available at www.weather.gov/lacrosse. The next statement will be issued Tuesday morning at 730 AM CST.
